page.title: 01MORWENSTOW GAZETTEER
page.content: The area is mainly Morwenstow the most northerly parish in Cornwall,with part of Kilkhampton. It is mainly farmland on the Atlantic coast over 400ft asl. Here are hamlets of Coombe and Woodford with many small scattered farms. No major roads cross the area and high ways range from good unclassified roads to footpaths. A very scenic area with wide views as trees only grow in the deep coombes. The area is remote and secluded with the only outside influence coming from CSOS Morwenstow, a satellite research station. Visitors are welcomed but determined with many merely passng through on the North Cornwall Coastal footpath. Those who do stay fall in love with this unspoiled area and are captivated. They frequently return year after year.
